dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, kicking off this episode, we've been looking at some really interesting news coming out of Saudi Arabia regarding their approach to, like, social responsibility.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, kicking off this episode, we've been looking at some really interesting news coming out of Saudi Arabia regarding their approach to, like, social responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty fascinating, right? The Minister of Human Resources, Ahmad Al-Rajhi, he, um, like, opened this forum talking about creating a *world-class* platform for social responsibility dialogue. That's a big claim.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty fascinating, right? The Minister of Human Resources, Ahmad Al-Rajhi, he, um, like, opened this forum talking about creating a world-class platform for social responsibility dialogue. That's a big claim.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the opening of the Forum, Saudi Minister of Human Resources and Social Development, Ahmad Al-Rajhi highlighted Saudi Arabias vision to establish a world-class platform for social responsibility dialogue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And it's not just talk, you know? He really emphasized fostering global partnerships and, like, creating new models for public-private collaboration in sustainable development.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And it's not just talk, you know? He really emphasized fostering global partnerships and, like, creating new models for public-private collaboration in sustainable development.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This forum aims to foster global partnerships and create new models for public-private collaboration in sustainable development, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And what I found really striking was his point on the *evolution* of corporate social responsibility. It's not just about, like, charity anymore. He talked about innovation, sustainable digitization, integrating tech, recycling...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And what I found really striking was his point on the evolution of corporate social responsibility. It's not just about, like, charity anymore. He talked about innovation, sustainable digitization, integrating tech, recycling...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Al-Rajhi outlined the evolution of corporate social responsibility, emphasizing its increasing focus on innovation, sustainable digitization, and strategic transformation. He underlined the growing trend of companies integrating technology, recycling, and circular economy principles into their daily operations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, completely. It's a strategic shift, incorporating circular economy principles and renewable energy. And he really hammered home the private sector's vital role in all this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, completely. It's a strategic shift, incorporating circular economy principles and renewable energy. And he really hammered home the private sector's vital role in all this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He underlined the growing trend of companies integrating technology, recycling, and circular economy principles into their daily operations. This shift includes renewable energy to drive environmental sustainability, human development, and balanced community growth. The Minister concluded by recognizing the private sector's vital role in creating a better world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And they've got the numbers to back it up too, which is, uh, pretty impressive. I mean, they've actually implemented key initiatives, like a dedicated social responsibility committee and a national strategy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they've got the numbers to back it up too, which is, uh, pretty impressive. I mean, they've actually implemented key initiatives, like a dedicated social responsibility committee and a national strategy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These include the formation of a dedicated social responsibility committee, the creation of a national strategy, and the launch of a national platform to drive transparency in social responsibility reporting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] And the *numbers* are wild! Social spending contributions jumped from like 1.19% in 2019 to over 4% by the end of last year. That's huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the numbers are wild! Social spending contributions jumped from like one point one nine percent in twenty nineteen to over four percent by the end of last year. That's huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These contributions to social spending jumped from 1.19% in 2019 to 4.15% by the end of 2023, while the percentage of large companies with CSR programs jumped from 30% to 65% during the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the percentage of large companies with CSR programs? That went from 30% to 65% in the same period. It's a massive jump.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the percentage of large companies with C S R programs? That went from thirty percent to sixty five percent in the same period. It's a massive jump.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: while the percentage of large companies with CSR programs jumped from 30% to 65% during the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: All this progress, like, it's reflected in their global ranking too. They've climbed to 16th place in the IMD World Competitiveness Yearbook for social responsibility.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: All this progress, like, it's reflected in their global ranking too. They've climbed to sixteenth place in the I M D World Competitiveness Yearbook for social responsibility.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This progress is reflected in Saudi Arabia's improved global ranking, climbing to 16th place in the IMD World Competitiveness Yearbook 2024's Social Responsibility Index, up from 41st in 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, that's up from 41st in just a few years! And the minister's, like, really confident they'll be among the top CSR countries by 2030.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, that's up from forty first in just a few years! And the minister's, like, really confident they'll be among the top C S R countries by twenty thirty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This progress is reflected in Saudi Arabia's improved global ranking, climbing to 16th place in the IMD World Competitiveness Yearbook 2024's Social Responsibility Index, up from 41st in 2021. The Minister was confident that Saudi Arabia will be even more highly rated among the top CSR countries in the world by 2030.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh huh. Speaking of confidence, other leaders were there too. Rola Abu Maneah from Standard Chartered, she really highlighted the importance of ESG reports for transparency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh huh. Speaking of confidence, other leaders were there too. Rola Abu Maneah from Standard Chartered, she really highlighted the importance of E S G reports for transparency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rola Abu Maneah, CEO of Standard Chartered Bank for the Middle East, agreed on the importance of the private sector to CSR: Voluntary Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) reports play a vital role in enhancing transparency and increasing investor awareness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Boeing's Brendan Nelson, he stressed well-planned strategies and, like, respecting local cultures and regulations. That's a key point.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Boeing's Brendan Nelson, he stressed well-planned strategies and, like, respecting local cultures and regulations. That's a key point.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Speaking of the importance of strategy and respect, Brendan Nelson, President of Boeing Global said: Investing in social responsibility requires well-planned corporate strategies that help achieve objectives and address challenges. Maintaining company values and standards while respecting the cultures and regulations of host countries is equally essential.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, Faris Al-Ghannam from HSBC Saudi Arabia, he showed a practical example, like, nurturing Saudi talent and promoting regenerative agriculture.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, Faris Al-Ghannam from H S B C Saudi Arabia, he showed a practical example, like, nurturing Saudi talent and promoting regenerative agriculture.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At HSBC Saudi Arabia, CEO Faris Al-Ghannam saw his organization as an example of the progress the Kingdom has achieved: We are dedicated to nurturing Saudi talent and have introduced a competition to promote regenerative agriculture in partnership with a non-profit organization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, um, it really seems like the Ministry, through this forum, is serious about driving excellence, competitiveness, and fostering international collaboration in CSR.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, um, it really seems like the Ministry, through this forum, is serious about driving excellence, competitiveness, and fostering international collaboration in C S R.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Via the Global CSR Forum, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development aims to promote excellence and competitiveness, encourage partnerships across sectors, and pave the way for international collaboration in CSR.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. A really strong, concerted effort for, uh, a more responsible and sustainable future.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. A really strong, concerted effort for, uh, a more responsible and sustainable future.
